tooltip.dsName: Please use Latin based characters only and numbers, without spaces or symbols (besides _ or ~)

tooltip.training_set: Make sure the training set selected, represents the whole data set adequately. Use the selected range if the appropriate training set has been identified, if not , it is a best practice to use the training set that is randomly selected by the system.

Beta: Preview/trial version release.

tooltip.lock_info: The status of this entity is locked as it is an active member of the Analysis chain. to unlock it, delete the chain.
tooltip.profile_time_window: Usage:determines the time period of the data update
tooltip.profile_update_fixed: Fixed: window of data update is fixed by the time period set in profile type window
tooltip.profile_update_sliding: Sliding: window of data update is offset by the time period set in the sliding window
tooltip.late_arrivals: Usage:Time period that allows data arriving after set update time to be included in the profile
tooltip.parent_date_reference_tooltip: Required Parent Datetime Field/Feature name.  Type initial letters of name to autocomplete.
tooltip.identifier: A unique identifier is required for this entity
tooltip.occurred_on: It is highly recommended to add the Occurred on field in the schema, in this way you can avoid serious potential implications
tooltip.occurred_on_needed: Occurred on flag should be set on a date/time field for upload by time interval to properly work

data_file.location_tip: After clicking the `create` button, place your data in this path

fields.union_note_no_pks: Note: Unique Unions require a level 1 primary key defined in the Data Frame schema.
fields.union_type_information:
Supported Union types:
1. Unique: Displays only one data source row (at random) when tracing back to anomaly source (Note: selecting this union type may impact performance).
2. All: Displays source rows from all union data sources when tracing back to anomaly source.
fields.raw_input: Pre-upload data older than the set time period will be purged
fields.data_uploaded: Processed data older than the set time period will be purged

common.dates_not_reoccur: Warning: Dates that do not reoccur on certain months should not be set at trigger dates (e.g. 29, 30 & 31)

date_format.from_list_tip: Select either a date/time format, or both. If both types are selected, a date and time format will be formatted in which both types are concatenated into a single type, separated by a single space separator
date_format.custom_tip: Input a custom date/time format, if the date and time format used in the data cannot be constructed from any of the date/time formats provided in the above list(s)
date_format.multi_values_note: Note: Multiple data formats for selected fields

upload_data.choose_one: Please choose one of the options
upload_data.append_info: Using the Append method adds new data, although where the same data already exists, the data is duplicated
upload_data.overwrite_info: Using the Overwrite method adds new data by overwriting existing data
upload_data.update_info: The Update method adds new data rows to the Data Source and updates existing rows.
upload_data.update_info_note: Note: it requires a mandatory primary key and may impact negatively on performance
upload_data.update_info_note_primary_keys_missing: Note: to enable upload, define a primary key in the Data Source schema.
upload_data.append_text: You are uploading in Append mode
upload_data.update_text: You are uploading in Update mode
upload_data.overwrite_text: You are uploading in Overwrite mode

Delete conditions?
Existing conditions will be deleted, and no conditions will be defined for the analysis

publisher.body_publish_modal:
Publish Alerts ?

cluster_anomalies.min_cluster_info: This setting defines the minimum size of anomaly clusters. (Min: {{min}}, Max: None, Default: {{default}})
cluster_anomalies.order_sensitive_info: Features will be applied according to order of importance
cluster_anomalies.clustering_method_info:
Options:
By Pattern: clustering by number of same trigger features
By Density: clustering  by relative proximity to other anomalies
cluster_anomalies.homogeneity_threshold_info: This setting sets the percentage homogeneity threshold level of clusters. Note; the higher the setting, the more homogeneous the cluster but, if set too high, may limit inclusion of insightful anomalies.
cluster_anomalies.trigger_features_info: This setting defines the number of key trigger features / by pattern to be included in the homogeneity score calculation.
cluster_anomalies.trigger_features: Number of trigger features for homogeneity score
cluster_anomalies.trigger_features_by_pattern: Number of Trigger Features for Clustering

validations.max_size: The Maximum cluster size cannot exceed

validations.size: Value must be smaller then or equal to
validations.overflow: Value must be smaller than maximum number of rows

validations.min_size: Value is lower than minimum allowed
validations.min_exceed_size: The second value must be greater than the first value
validations.max_exceed_size: The first value must be lower than the second value
validations.negative_value_not_valid: the value cannot be negative or zero
validations.name_composition_length: Composition name exceeds max length of 255 characters
validations.composition_value_length: Composition value exceeds max length of 255 characters
validations.invalid_processing_window: Invalid entry - should be between 15 and 30 minutes

import_metadata_form.import_metadata_warning:
Important Note: Import will fail if imported chains contain entities with the same name as existing chain entities and both chains do not have the same structure. 
If import does fail, check if there are entities in both locations with same name, rename and retry import.
Continue?

export_metadata_form.add_normality_and_cluster_models_info:
When toggle enabled, normality and cluster models will be exported. 
Analyses that do not include normality and cluster models will still be migrated.

no_info_available_traceback.technical_issue: No data retrieved for the requested Data Source due to a technical issue
no_info_available_traceback.no_info: Investigation data is not available for display
no_info_available_traceback.no_info_reasons: This can be due to one of the following reasons
no_info_available_traceback.data_retrieval_is_in_progress: Data retrieval is in progress - try to display again shortly
no_info_available_traceback.make_sure_that_investigation_data_is_ena: Make sure that investigation data is enabled
no_info_available_traceback.analysis_explain: A recently completed analysis is still processing the anomaly investigation information and the system database is currently bing updated.
no_info_available_traceback.suggested_resolution_explain: if the anomaly investigation query is related to an analisys that has just completed, try either refreshing the display, or retrying the anomaly investigation function after a short period of time
no_info_available_traceback.previous_release_issue_explain: The anomaly selected was detected while the system was running a previos release that did not support anomaly investigation. subsequently. no information is available for the anomaly.

Value options: Event data, Other.
Event data (e.g., transactions, swift messages) is the data on which analytics runs; it must include a date/time field.

queue_order.tooltip: Define the order of the "Unassigned Alerts" view and the order of the alert queue that is used for the "Get Alert" feature

alert_tabs.custom_alerts_tab_tooltip: These can be used to organize information related to the alert for specific use cases

tab_fields.days_before: days before the first alert transaction and

resolution_code.title: Resolution Codes
resolution_code.title_tooltip: Define the possible analysis resolutions (Note: Once an alert has been marked with a resolution code, the resolution code cannot be removed, only deactivated)
resolution_code.classification_tooltip: Mark resolution code "Productive" if the alert was justified. Mark resolution code "Non-Productive" if not.
resolution_code.condition_tooltip:
Active resolution codes are available when a resolution is recommended or when an alert is closed. They also serve as the values for the recommendation code filter.

Resolution codes that were previously selected for alerts cannot be completely deleted; instead, they become inactive if they should not be used anymore. Inactive resolution codes will still appear in the recommendation code filter.
